discord_workflow_test_scenarios.overview: Test scenarios to validate the Discord-only workflow functionality. These tests ensure the mode correctly handles various user requests for Discord formatting.

scenario.name: Single existing version
scenario.expected_behavior: 1. Detect Discord-only workflow pattern 2. Parse version: 3.23.14 3. Check if docs/update-notes/v3.23.14.mdx exists 4. Read file and apply Discord transformations 5. Output formatted text with footer link
scenario.validation: - No GitHub API calls made - No files created or modified - PR links removed from output - Internal links converted to full URLs

scenario.name: Multiple existing versions
scenario.user_input: Generate Discord format for v3.23.14, v3.23.15, v3.23.16
scenario.expected_behavior: 1. Detect Discord-only workflow pattern 2. Parse versions: 3.23.14, 3.23.15, 3.23.16 3. Check existence of all three files 4. Process each existing file 5. Output combined Discord announcement
scenario.validation: - Each version gets its own section - Footer includes links to all versions - Consistent formatting across versions

scenario.name: Mixed existing and missing versions
scenario.expected_behavior: 1. Parse versions: 3.23.14, 3.23.99 2. Check files: v3.23.14.mdx exists, v3.23.99.mdx missing 3. Ask user how to proceed with missing version 4. Based on response, either: - Process only existing version - Offer to create missing release notes first
scenario.validation: - Clear error message about missing version - Actionable suggestions provided - Graceful handling of partial success

scenario.name: With compression request
scenario.user_input: Discord notes for 3.23.14, compress the bug fixes
scenario.expected_behavior: 1. Detect Discord-only workflow and compression flag 2. Process version with compression 3. Summarize bug fixes section 4. Output condensed format
scenario.validation: - Bug fixes compressed into summary - Major features remain expanded - Contributor list preserved in summary

scenario.name: Invalid version format
scenario.expected_behavior: 1. Detect incomplete version number 2. Ask for clarification 3. Suggest checking available versions
scenario.validation: - Clear error about version format - Helpful suggestions provided

scenario.name: Ambiguous request (not Discord-specific)
scenario.expected_behavior: 1. Detect main workflow pattern (not Discord-only) 2. Proceed with full release notes creation 3. Fetch PRs from GitHub
scenario.validation: - Does NOT trigger Discord-only workflow - Follows standard release notes creation

scenario.name: Discord with date range
scenario.user_input: Discord release notes for all versions from 3.23.10 to 3.23.14
scenario.expected_behavior: 1. Recognize range request 2. List files in update-notes directory 3. Find all versions in range 4. Process each found version
scenario.validation: - Correctly identifies versions in range - Processes in version order - Combined output for all versions

scenario.name: Combined format request
scenario.user_input: Combine Discord release notes for 3.23.14 and 3.23.15
scenario.expected_behavior: 1. Detect "combine" keyword 2. Parse versions: 3.23.14, 3.23.15 3. Check both files exist 4. Read and process both versions 5. Merge content by category with version indicators 6. Output single combined announcement
scenario.validation: - Features from both versions in one section - Bug fixes merged with version tags - No duplicate sections - Version indicators on each item

scenario.name: Multiple patch versions auto-combine
scenario.expected_behavior: 1. Detect consecutive patch versions 2. Automatically choose combined format 3. Merge all content with version tags 4. Present unified announcement
scenario.validation: - Smart format selection based on version proximity - Clear version attribution for each change - Consolidated contributor list

scenario.name: Mixed major/minor versions
scenario.expected_behavior: 1. Detect mix of major/minor versions 2. Use separate format (not combined) 3. Create section for each version 4. Maintain clear separation
scenario.validation: - Each version gets its own section - No attempt to merge different minor versions - Clear version headers

case.name: empty_version_list
case.expected: Ask user to specify version numbers

case.name: typo_in_command
case.expected: May not trigger Discord workflow - handle gracefully

case.name: very_long_version_list
case.input: Discord format for v3.23.1, v3.23.2, v3.23.3, ... (20+ versions)
case.expected: Process all but suggest breaking into smaller groups

case.name: explicit_separate_request
case.input: Discord release notes for 3.23.14 and 3.23.15 separately
case.expected: Use separate format even for consecutive patches

case.name: combine_non_consecutive
case.expected: Still combine but note version gap

test.name: workflow_switching
test.steps: 1. Start with Discord-only request 2. If version missing, offer to create it 3. If user accepts, switch to main workflow 4. After creation, return to Discord formatting

case.input: Generate Discord-formatted release notes for version 3.23.14

test.name: format_selection_logic
test.description: Verify correct format selection based on context

case.expected_format: combined (respecting user request despite major versions)

test.name: content_merging
test.description: Verify proper content merging in combined format

validations.validation: Version tags added to each item
